conbody.p: This is an introduction to the DITA profiling/conditional text feature.
Profiling conditions can be set both within topics and in maps.

Conditional tags are a useful feature that allows you to hide specific elements or content within a document. They can be used to hide paragraphs, steps in a procedure, items in a list, or even phrases within a sentence. Additionally, conditional tags can be used to hide entire topics or groups of topics in a map, which allows for the creation of different publications from a single map by applying profiling conditions to the build.

ul.li: Hide an element (such as a paragraph)
Hide a step in a procedure
Hide an item in a list
Hide a phrase within a sentence
Hide an entire topic or group of topics in a map
Create different publications from a single map by applying profiling conditions to the build
